g.text: 5. Conclusion
The oral form of anti
ﬁ
brinolytics in TKA is able to signi
ﬁ
cantly
decrease blood loss, postoperative hemoglobin reduction, as well
as transfusion requirements. No increased risk of postoperative
complications was observed. Higher quality RCTs is necessary to
con
ﬁ
rm our
ﬁ
nding.
Author contributions
Hua Li
ﬁ
nishes the manuscript. Liqun Bai collects data. Yunhai Li
and Zhiyuan Fang design the study. All authors read and
approved the
ﬁ
nal manuscript.
Data curation:
Liqun Bai, Yunhai Li, Zhiyuan Fang.
Writing
original draft:
Hua Li.

arthroplasty for osteoarthritis of the knee: a retrospective analysis of

ﬁ
cacy of oral versus intravenous tranexamic acid after total knee
